message.content:
cs.RO, cs.HC, cs.CV, cs.SY, cs.LG. 

This paper presents a method for robot-assisted dressing that involves tracking a person's pose in real-time using capacitive proximity sensing. The paper focuses on the robotics aspect of the research, which suggests that it is most likely to belong to the cs.RO (Robotics) sub-category. However, the paper also discusses how the technology can assist people with motor impairments, which suggests that it could also belong to the cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) sub-category. The paper uses vision-based techniques, which suggests that it could also belong to the cs.CV (Computer Vision) sub-category. The paper also discusses how the robot can adapt to human motion in real-time, which suggests that it could belong to the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category. Finally, the paper uses machine learning techniques to adjust for errors in the estimated pose of a person, which suggests that it could also belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category.
